keys.descriptionHTML: Adds a public SSH key to the authenticated user's GitHub account. Requires that you are authenticated via Basic Auth, or OAuth with at least write:public_key scope.

keys.title: Get a public SSH key for the authenticated user
keys.descriptionHTML: View extended details for a single public SSH key. Requires that you are authenticated via Basic Auth or via OAuth with at least read:public_key scope.

keys.title: Delete a public SSH key for the authenticated user
keys.descriptionHTML: Removes a public SSH key from the authenticated user's GitHub account. Requires that you are authenticated via Basic Auth or via OAuth with at least admin:public_key scope.

keys.title: List public keys for a user

parameters.name: page
parameters.descriptionHtml: Page number of the results to fetch.

keys.descriptionHTML: Lists the verified public SSH keys for a user. This is accessible by anyone.

repo-config.title: Get a webhook configuration for a repository
repo-config.descriptionHTML:
Returns the webhook configuration for a repository. To get more information about the webhook, including the active state and events, use "Get a repository webhook."

Access tokens must have the read:repo_hook or repo scope, and GitHub Apps must have the repository_hooks:read permission.

repo-config.title: Update a webhook configuration for a repository

bodyParameters.description: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
bodyParameters.name: url
bodyParameters.rawDescription: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

bodyParameters.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
bodyParameters.name: content_type
bodyParameters.rawDescription: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include `json` and `form`. The default is `form`.

bodyParameters.description: If provided, the secret will be used as the key to generate the HMAC hex digest value for delivery signature headers.
bodyParameters.name: secret
bodyParameters.rawDescription: If provided, the `secret` will be used as the `key` to generate the HMAC hex digest value for [delivery signature headers](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.2/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers).

oneOf.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for `url` will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include `0` (verification is performed) and `1` (verification is not performed). The default is `0`. **We strongly recommend not setting this to `1` as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.**

bodyParameters.name: insecure_ssl
bodyParameters.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include 0 (verification is performed) and 1 (verification is not performed). The default is 0. We strongly recommend not setting this to 1 as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.

repo-config.descriptionHTML:
Updates the webhook configuration for a repository. To update more information about the webhook, including the active state and events, use "Update a repository webhook."

Access tokens must have the write:repo_hook or repo scope, and GitHub Apps must have the repository_hooks:write permission.

repo-deliveries.title: List deliveries for a repository webhook

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.descriptionHtml: Used for pagination: the starting delivery from which the page of deliveries is fetched. Refer to the link header for the next and previous page cursors.

repo-deliveries.descriptionHTML: Returns a list of webhook deliveries for a webhook configured in a repository.

repo-deliveries.title: Get a delivery for a repository webhook
repo-deliveries.descriptionHTML: Returns a delivery for a webhook configured in a repository.

repo-deliveries.title: Redeliver a delivery for a repository webhook
repo-deliveries.descriptionHTML: Redeliver a webhook delivery for a webhook configured in a repository.

parameters.name: page
parameters.descriptionHtml: Page number of the results to fetch.

repos.title: Create a repository webhook

bodyParameters.description: Use web to create a webhook. Default: web. This parameter only accepts the value web.
bodyParameters.name: name
bodyParameters.rawDescription: Use `web` to create a webhook. Default: `web`. This parameter only accepts the value `web`.

bodyParameters.description: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. These are defined below.

url.description: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
url.name: url
url.rawDescription: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

content_type.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
content_type.name: content_type
content_type.rawDescription: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include `json` and `form`. The default is `form`.

secret.description: If provided, the secret will be used as the key to generate the HMAC hex digest value for delivery signature headers.
secret.name: secret
secret.rawDescription: If provided, the `secret` will be used as the `key` to generate the HMAC hex digest value for [delivery signature headers](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.2/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers).

oneOf.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for `url` will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include `0` (verification is performed) and `1` (verification is not performed). The default is `0`. **We strongly recommend not setting this to `1` as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.**

insecure_ssl.name: insecure_ssl
insecure_ssl.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include 0 (verification is performed) and 1 (verification is not performed). The default is 0. We strongly recommend not setting this to 1 as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.

bodyParameters.name: config
bodyParameters.rawDescription: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. [These are defined below](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.2/rest/reference/repos#create-hook-config-params).

oneOf.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for `url` will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include `0` (verification is performed) and `1` (verification is not performed). The default is `0`. **We strongly recommend not setting this to `1` as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.**

params.name: insecure_ssl
params.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include 0 (verification is performed) and 1 (verification is not performed). The default is 0. We strongly recommend not setting this to 1 as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.

bodyParameters.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for.
bodyParameters.name: events
bodyParameters.rawDescription: Determines what [events](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.2/webhooks/event-payloads) the hook is triggered for.

bodyParameters.description: Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to true to send notifications.
bodyParameters.name: active
bodyParameters.rawDescription: Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to `true` to send notifications.

repos.descriptionHTML: Repositories can have multiple webhooks installed. Each webhook should have a unique config. Multiple webhooks can share the same config as long as those webhooks do not have any events that overlap.

repos.title: Get a repository webhook
repos.descriptionHTML: Returns a webhook configured in a repository. To get only the webhook config properties, see "Get a webhook configuration for a repository."

repos.descriptionHTML: Updates a webhook configured in a repository. If you previously had a secret set, you must provide the same secret or set a new secret or the secret will be removed. If you are only updating individual webhook config properties, use "Update a webhook configuration for a repository."

repos.title: Ping a repository webhook
repos.descriptionHTML: This will trigger a ping event to be sent to the hook.

repos.title: Test the push repository webhook
repos.descriptionHTML:
This will trigger the hook with the latest push to the current repository if the hook is subscribed to push events. If the hook is not subscribed to push events, the server will respond with 204 but no test POST will be generated.

Note: Previously /repos/:owner/:repo/hooks/:hook_id/test
